website_summaries.verdict: A powerful subwoofer to support your other Sonos speakers with deep bass.
pros: If you're looking to supplement another Sonos speaker, the Sub is a solid pick
It takes over lower sounds so your other speakers can focus on mids and highs
Features a sleek design that looks great in your home
cons: Very expensive, especially considering that it is not a standalone speaker

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but is nice
customer_reviews.text: The price deterred me from getting this for a while, but as we continued to expand our Sonos system I thought I'd just bite the bullet and get it. I am glad I did! It really smooths out the sound in our main space which is a rather large room. The extra bass this provides over the speakers gives the overall sound a nice boost. It still seems like a lot of money to spend on it, but just like everything else we've bought from Sonos this works out-of-the-box with little configuration, and that is something we can really appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Wagner

customer_reviews.title: No, it's not an earthquake!
customer_reviews.text: Earth shattering lows without rattle, as advertised. Easy to configure / add to an existing Sonos center channel. I really like the ease of placement, since there are no wires or cables to run, other than to a power outlet. The only negative is the price: $700 is a bit stiff considering (if you like wires) a decent receiver / sub combo would be a couple hundred dollars less, but now that we own it, well...we really like it!
customer_reviews.author: DavidO1

customer_reviews.title: LOVE MY SONOS!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just got into SONOS recently I started off with 2 play1s, and Im not a audiophile, but I do like quality products.The design os this sub is like no other, bass is tight, deep and accurate through all frequencies. Price is a little steep but I believe it was worth the extra expense. Watching movies is where I believe this sub performs at its best. Unbelievable this little unit puts out such quality bass. I use it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: MIKEY-fix-THIS

customer_reviews.title: Perfecto!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome addition to my playbar + surround setting. The bass difference is a quite noticeable. I don't listen at high volumes, the bass has to be high quality that does justice to the soundstage and this woofer delivers! The bass is rich and widens the soundstage. The bonus is that the midrange is better too because playbar adjusts its frequency response towards the middle as it no longer has to worry about the lows.
customer_reviews.author: Akhil

customer_reviews.title: Enormous improvement in the sound of a stereo pair of PLAY:1s
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I added it to a stereo pair of PLAY:1's and it transformed the listening experience. It arrived today. Setup took about 20 minutes from the time I picked it up at the front door until I was enjoying the sound. Setup was about as simple as it could be. Plug it in, add it to the system using the instructions in the app and enjoy Appearance is simple and clean, a real benefit considering many subwoofers are a decorating disaster.
customer_reviews.author: Gortzh

customer_reviews.title: A little too weak
customer_reviews.text: Definitely enhances the Playbase but to me the bass is not as powerful as the price might indicate.
customer_reviews.author: Love Great Products

customer_reviews.title: Makes the soundbar complete, period
customer_reviews.text: Money well spent, I purposely used my soundbar without the subwoofer off and on and I could never go back to not having this.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Nicholas Howe

customer_reviews.title: I love love bass in movies and music and all my ...
customer_reviews.text: I love love bass in movies and music and all my life have bought Bose I’ve tried Sonos and I absolutely love it and it’s worth every penny this is my new speakers for everything
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Buggy and unstable
customer_reviews.text: Music routinely skips and frequently stops completely. I have the fastest Internet speed, my router new and located in the same room as two speakers that frequently cut out (they all do). Sometimes, speakers or the sub disappear from my account completely and I have to re-add them. These are known issues on which Sonos’ workaround is to blame your router.
customer_reviews.author: J Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing update to system
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Sonos sound bar and surround speakers to go with a new Samsung QLED TV. Did a lot of homework before going with Sonos. Love the sound. After reading some reviews I decided to add the bass unit. I am blown away by the difference in sound. One review said it allowed the other speakers to focus on the mids and highs instead of trying to produce lows. An understatement at best. The sound is truly amazing. If the old system was a 10, the bass makes it a 20. I have a room full of clear, bright, full range sound. I could not be happier. Costly, yes. Worth it, definitely.
customer_reviews.author: R2

customer_reviews.title: Movie night is every night
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted to own a Sonos home theatre so I finally have my own and the sound quality is amazing. Please invest and get this system.
customer_reviews.author: Jamarr Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the best sub ever!
customer_reviews.text: This tiny sub is a beast! I was very skeptical of Sonos and especially this sub. It was pretty pricey and it didn’t look like much, although it looked cool. However, this sub will shake the hell out of your home! I bought it for my business, a lounge/bar, hoping to fill in the sound of the little Sonos speakers, which are great for what they are. This little sucker pounds like a MTX 15”, maybe harder! Please, know that I have very high standards for audio equipment and this unit is everything and more. That said, I would not recommend this to anyone living in an apartment or townhouse as this will penetrate walls with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher D. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: be careful DO NOT BUY this product or any other of this brand, sonos has just sent a notice to the users of its older product, that they say there will be no more updates and these speakers will not work after some time, that is, you will be buying a very expensive system and will be abandoned at your own luck, at a nearby future, unfortunately I wasn't aware of this when I bought more than thirty Sonos equipment, you must choose another brand, this one will not be worried about your future and you will be discarded BE ADVISED
customer_reviews.author: marco silva

customer_reviews.title: Will hit harder than you think. Did I say it is a work of art? Just buy it! you won't regret it ;-)
customer_reviews.text: This thing is expensive but it is a work of art. Looks small but once properly setup it can hit very hard. Just so you know what kind of listener I am, I have subwoofers on all my cars. So no sissy bass for me. I am using it in a room about 18x35 and it will go low and loud with the right tunes. Highly recommend it. These Sonos units have me addicted!
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: GOOD LORD
customer_reviews.text: If you have the sound bar this is a definite must. Plug it in and open the app. It finds itself and within seconds its connected. For the first couple of hours we really didnt hear it to much. But it seemed to be finding its way cause by that night you heard and felt it. It was about 6 inches from a couch and you could feel it while sitting. Dont waste your time with any other one if you have a Sonos sound bar. You will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Will be an expensive brick in 5 yes, DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: First off, I loved Sonos. It just worked, it might have been more expensive but the sound quality was decent enough and it just worked. Easy peasy. The overall performance of the device deserves 5 stars, but the deserves 1 star for its recent decision to sunset it's legacy gear that still works to increase their device sales. Basically, they want to be a home audio subscription service, not a device seller. Ive recommended this system for years to lots of people l, but unless Sonos changes their policy on "legacy" devices, I won't buy another Sonos product. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Deeb

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Blinking white lights, Conflicting suppoort. For 700$ it is terrible
customer_reviews.author: Sandman

customer_reviews.title: Great, expensive, one major flaw called Sonos ducking....google it
customer_reviews.text: Had to factory reset out of the box to connect to new sound bar. After that, wow...it’s amazing. Having a hard time saying it’s worth 700 bucks...but it does pump out the thunderous bass. One side note, and a very annoying one that no one seems to mention about Alexa integration....is that when someone activates their echo in the house, and I have a out eight...the audio cuts out until that person is done communicating with the echo...it’s called ducking, and there is apparently no resolution for it on either the amazon, or Sonos side. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: SteveO

customer_reviews.title: couldn't be happier. A work of art with incredible
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted this for so long but didn't want to pay the high price, finally purchased, couldn't be happier. A work of art with incredible sound
customer_reviews.author: otisraccoon

customer_reviews.title: Definitely makes a difference.
customer_reviews.text: I own a single Sonos 5 second generation and this sub has a significant impact on the overall sound of the 5 which is very solid without a sub. . It's very impressive and delivers pretty tight room shaking bottom end that you feel in your chest cavity at higher volume. Do not believe any reviewer who claims that it makes no difference in conjunction with the Sonos 5.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin A Martin

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product -- Sonos Platform Sucks
customer_reviews.text: Spent over an hour trying to link the sub to a Sonos Beam. No luck. And all Sonos Support will suggest is that you unplug and reset all of your Sonos devices and controllers, which itself can take hours if you have a lot of devices and controllers. Terrible software, unstable apps, quirky interface. Nothing good any longer. Avoid Sonos at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: MSM

customer_reviews.title: Hits hard
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about the price of this sub, but had already decided I was going to use the SONOS brand throughout my home. Matched to my Beam the combination works great! The sub does it’s job and has that hard hitting bass. It’s compact enough to be visually unnoticed, not having to run wires makes it very versatile when it comes to placement. It’s a little expensive, if you have the money to spend and already use SONOS speakers in your home then why not. Can’t really complaint about the price, it’s like buying a Ferrari and complaining about the $10k brake job. If Sonos is too expensive for you buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTAND thump! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.text: A must have addition to any Sonos system. This allows us to not only hear the sound but actually feel it; especially watching movies. Having no speaker wire to route anywhere makes it worth having, but the fairly easy automatic setup makes it worth the money. Keep in mind, depending on the room setup, could make a difference in sound quality. Not disappointed, but it is a fairly good size box. You might want to keep that in mind when trying to put that in the "perfect" spot. Sonos setup says up front left (maybe right) but we ended up putting it behind our couch after initial setup. Perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: 1RadMomof5

customer_reviews.title: Is it worth it?
customer_reviews.text: Big Sonos fan and I like my music to sound good so decided to splurge on this sub based largely on the many good reviews. Sorry to say I’ve been a little underwhelmed and disappointed. Does it make my system sound better... yes. Does it bring out the highs and mid levels on my existing Play 3’s... yes. But the big question for me is... does it make my system sound $700 better?! I’d have to say probably not. Will likely return it rather than constantly be reminded of that every time I listen.
customer_reviews.author: PlaysInPeoria

customer_reviews.title: Just Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This little box is amazing to me. I just installed my sonos beam sound bar and this bass box it it sounds amazing. I watched an action scene on a movie and it sounded better than the movie theater, and I haven't even installed the rear sonos 1sL speaker yet. There coming in tomorrow. but the Explosion scene sounds amazing and the beam is so clear. Everything sounds great. This is an expensive purchase but it well worth it. I'm definitely going to replace all my google mini's with the sonos one 2gen. Really a great product.
customer_reviews.author: james hughes

customer_reviews.title: Bass for people who love bass...Rattle your teeth, organs, walls
customer_reviews.text: Whoa!! This thing ROCKS like a mutha!! I've had good speakers, some good subs before, but wow. This thing is a thumper and rattles your bones and the walls in your house and affects the operation of your internal organs. And looks classy and clean while doing it..... Pricey, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S. Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Crazy Expensive but works well
customer_reviews.text: I only added this to my TV sound System because I had over $400 worth of Amazon points to put towards it. Sonos components are crazy expensive. I did the same thing when I got the Sonos Playbase so now I have a 5.1 Sonos sound system that works great. (I also have 2 Sono:1's as the rear speakers.
customer_reviews.author: JAP73

customer_reviews.title: Sonos is bricking older units.. not worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Sonos has decided to brick and disable older units.. meaning they could do the same to this expensive sub in a few year. Not worth the investment with the limited life span for these products. I bought 3 Sonos connects just a few years ago at almost $400 for each. Just received an email that these would not longer work after May 2020. Thank goodness I’m within the return window and can get a refund. I will never buy another Sonos product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: No Support of Apple iOS Mobile Devices
customer_reviews.text: Anyone buying Sonos products needs to know they no longer support Apple iOS mobile devices. This was a bad decision by Sonos not to support Apple users since most people use mobile devices rather than their computers. I will not buy anymore Sonos products or recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Added Sub to a Beam
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased a Beam set up was cake. Upon listening to the first song I realized I wanted the Sub. Waited for a sale price and just added the Sub. Sounds amazing perfect theater bass no distortion. Set up through the app was easy. I did need to do it twice but I left the room while it was doing an update so I may have missed a step. Took about 10 minutes to set up. App has easy equalizer setting so you can easily adjust the bass depending on what you listening to. I would recommend this if you like Sonos products. Really brings sound to another level.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Thresher

customer_reviews.title: Great Sub; Beats Bose Hands Down
customer_reviews.text: Great subwoofer that fits with the outstanding Sonos product line. Bass is great, and MUCH better than the equivalent model Bose subwoofer. Actually returned my entire Bose soundbar system because its subwoofer was so inferior to the Sonos model. Great decision!
customer_reviews.author: Korey Steven Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound!
customer_reviews.text: It was well worth the price! We had already purchased the Beam and two Play1 speakers. At the time we wanted to see how those sounded before investing more into the sound system for our TV. Those alone sounded great, but with the Sonos Sub.....WOW!! it sounds amazing! Love that they can be used to play music too! Great sound system, worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: MDC65

customer_reviews.title: Makes a big different
customer_reviews.text: Bought the beam and sub. set up was (too) easy and sounds great once I did the tuning with my iphone. The only reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 is because I ran into an issue when my router crashed (isp company sucks) and I had to reset the system. There was ZERO support. Fortunately through forums and on line chat rooms the info was there.
customer_reviews.author: Drewster

customer_reviews.title: Oh Baby! The room's a rockin!
customer_reviews.text: I added this to my kitchen with two speakers. Fantastic! Couldn't live without this, having heard it. Super easy to install, other than being told twice that it was previously installed and I had to reset it. Odd. The Sonos software and installation system is fantastic. I hard-wired the sub, which then feeds the speakers in the room. This has really changed our lives in the sense that music has become much more enjoyable and a major activity in the kitchen at night. It's pricey, but man does it add richness. Sometimes I crank up the bass for songs that showcase it and it's amazing.
customer_reviews.author: T. Beaulieu

customer_reviews.title: Buy this if you love bass!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is absolutely incredible. I feel like I’m back in high school with 2 12 inch woofers in my trunk. I paired this with one Play 5 and it brought so much more to my music!!! Thank you Sonos
customer_reviews.author: sean winfrey

customer_reviews.title: Turn it up! Holy Mackerel.
customer_reviews.text: This thing turns a Sonos system into a powerhouse. Annoy the neighbors! Make things fall off shelves! Loosen a filling! Holy cow. A great Sonos soundbar with this thing in the mix, turns your house into a tub-thumping party delight. Pricey but worth every penny in the land of upgrades. This is one of those hidden in a corner, but added value through the roof purchases. If you have any other Sonos gear and you want to upgrade it to elite status, buy this. Simple to install, easy to forget until that tornado on screen happens, or the DubStep drops lol. Hope that helps, happy bassing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Allred

customer_reviews.title: Very few things in life work as advertised, this works better.
customer_reviews.text: This subwoofer is actually amazing! The best way to describe it would be to call it scientific sorcery. The Good: The bass in the sub will make you home and your teeth rattle. The Bad: Sonos markets their equipment and plug and play easy to set up. However, I have had two calls to customer service to add speakers to my system here. The Ugly: This subwoofer costs $699.99 and I got it on a sale for 599.99. Absolutely not the the best way to stay financially stable.
customer_reviews.author: Green_Steve

customer_reviews.title: Never listening without a sub again
customer_reviews.text: My listening experience went from OK to unbelievable. With open floor and high ceiling, a beam, and 3 speakers were not enough to fill the space. But now, waow, the music fills the whole house. If I had known, I would have bought it first with just a beam. Don't skimp, this is the best addition to Sonos system.
customer_reviews.author: C. C. T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound AND looks!!!
customer_reviews.text: The sub in white looks very nice!! Goes great with modern decor and would in any other setting where white would be complementary. The sound (as with the black finish model) is amazing and it was too easy to set up, download updates and tune the sound!! Sonos really has it together when it comes to providing quality products!!
customer_reviews.author: goanywhere

customer_reviews.title: Contrary to reviews....
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to set up with the exception of Alexa which is not Sonos' fault. The sound is phenomenal with great clarity, no distortion and plenty of power even at very low volumes. I hear the complaints that it is expensive....not compared to my Velodynes from 10 years ago ($1799) for $549, this subwoofer is absolutely fantastic quality out of the box. Fantastic looking, reliable, and enjoyable. You will definitely notice the difference when you add this to your other Sonos. (I have the 2nd gen Sonos one...four of them)
customer_reviews.author: V. Starr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound quality. I have always been a Bose fan but Sonos has made me a convert.
customer_reviews.author: Eric in CT

customer_reviews.title: laying down on the bottom shelf under tv) and the sound remains perfect at all times
customer_reviews.text: Got to go along with my Sonos sound base. The Bass that this puts out is outstanding. I have had it in several different locations (on side of tv, behind it, laying down on the bottom shelf under tv) and the sound remains perfect at all times.
customer_reviews.author: searching

customer_reviews.title: Great sub paired with Beam
customer_reviews.text: It’s Sonos, so it is expensive. But it looks high quality, it is very heavy, it sounds great. Setup is easy even though it uses a WiFi connection. Mine is paired with a Sonos Beam sound bar, used for our bedroom TV. Now movie soundtracks really rumble. We can also listen to music and even listen simultaneously on other Sonos systems throughout the house. Streaming music from iPhone and iPad is easy. We can easily access music streaming services or play from our own music library.
customer_reviews.author: PleasantCreek

customer_reviews.title: Great loud Subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: You haven't heard your Sonos speakers, until you pair it with the Sonos Subwoofer. It makes so much difference with and without subwoofer turned on. Pros: 1. Easy connectivity 2. Easy to manage with Sonos app 3. Loud heavy bass sound added to any existing Sonos speakers 4. Makes movies you watch when with paired with Soundbar, feel like your in the theaters. Cons: 1. Cost can be a bit high without one of Sonos' rare deals.
customer_reviews.author: T. Yu

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Been a Sonos fan for years, just added this and 2 Play 1 speakers for surround sound. Sub works fantastically, on pricey side but for not have to run cables/speaker wire worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pieper

customer_reviews.title: WOW great I have a Play5 with the sub makes the ...
customer_reviews.text: Wifey brought this for my father's day she knew I was looking at it. WOW great I have a Play5 with the sub makes the Play sound even better. Bass not to booming just right perfect speaker. Took longer to unpack than to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie Brown

customer_reviews.title: It’s all about the bass
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know what I was missing until we powered it up. We have a Sonos Playbar with two Play:1s. They are awesome, with great surround but not super bass. We read the reviews online, and took the modestly expensive plunge for this. Boy is it worth it! It provides a depth of sound to not only music but movies. During Iron Man 3, my son thought the explosions were an earthquake (we live in MN, he was sitting right next to the sub on the couch). It really completes are system:
customer_reviews.author: C. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but good
customer_reviews.text: Love how subtle the subwoofer is in a sense that it produces great bass where ever you have the sub placed. For me, i have the sun hidden behind my couch. It works great from that location and i can’t really tell where the bass is coming from. It’s definitely pricey and i did take one star off because i had connection issues out of the box which required me to unplug the sub and then re-setup the system for it to work correctly.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I have three of the PLAY:1's and decided to add this sub in. It totally transformed my listening experience! The lows that this thing has are absolutely impressive. I even stuck something on the top of it to see if it vibrated off, and it didn't even move! Sonos put a lot of time and effort into this sub. It's unfortunate that it's so pricy, but I see why. I love the fact that I can control bass/treble on the PLAY:1's, and increase the volume of the sub separately. Awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality with RICH lows. A must have to create surround sound 5.1 with your playbar and ones. VERY NICE!!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Way better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: This thing isn't large, but the range and quality of bass is astounding. Yes it is expensive, but it just works and works great. Don't regret it at all. Love that it fits behind furniture and is out of the way. I have sonos in multiple rooms. Including a two Play5s. They have really great range on their own. But the sub brings things to life in a great way. I highly recommend this with the 5.1 setup.
customer_reviews.author: chaw704352

customer_reviews.title: Sonos is GREAT
customer_reviews.text: So happy I finally took the plunge to add the Sonos Sub to my system. For years I had a Sub connected to my standard stereo. Once I bought the sound bar for my TV I found I rarely used my stereo. I played music through the sound bar instead. I did though, miss the base. The Sonos Sub easily connected to my Sonos system and to the sound bar. I've been a Sonos user since the very beginning, I love this product and the quality. Yes the price can be a bit much to swallow but you can count on the quality. Sonos simply works all the time, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Booboo18069

customer_reviews.title: The sound that comes out of this thing is awesome
customer_reviews.text: This sub comes with a hefty price, but the quality and output makes up for it. I built a 5.1 system with this sub, a beam, and two play ones and the results are outstanding. The sub fills out the low end fully and nicely for TV and music. For action movies it adds a level of realism not possible without it. Great product, if you have the money to invest in Sonos.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Once you hear it, you’ll know you’ve made the right choice.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing add on to a sonos system. It vibrates the air and not the ground so It is truly non rattle. I have it sitting in a TV console that is older and still no rattle even when I turn the base up on Max. Super crisp sound. Tip, in normal setting the base may seem low, but adjust it in settings and it booms! Love it, and changed the way I listen to music and watch TV. I have sonos beam with surround sound satellite play ones and it has taken it to a real next level experience.
customer_reviews.author: William Frederick

customer_reviews.title: It’s all about that Bass !
customer_reviews.text: Added the sub to my sonos ones and the beam and am extremely happy with the results. Used the tuning feature with my iPhone and really enhanced the overall sound. Highly Recommended !
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but extremely effective.
customer_reviews.text: This review is about 4 months after purchase. When I first got my beam and two play:1 set up the original system had a substantial amount of bass. While I was on the fence of getting the sub due to the price, I’m glad I did. The sub is so crisp with the bass it adds so much to whatever you’re watching without being excessive. If you can front the price tag, this truly completes a Sonos system.
customer_reviews.author: D3cipher

customer_reviews.title: On my second replacement from Sonos.  I hope this one will work correctly
customer_reviews.text: When the sub works, it is great! When it doesn't, it's a worthless paperweight. I've been on the phone with Sonos support for hours on end, awaiting the SECOND replacement from the factory (they send out refurbished units on warranty replacements, FYI. I bought a brand new one just under 2 months ago, but rate a rebuilt one when the first one doesnt work. Hmmm....)
customer_reviews.author: Grant Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, but not noticeable enough to warrant the cost
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing several other Sonos speakers (Sonos 1 and Soundbar), I decided to get the Sonos Sub to put in the living room with my Soundbar and two Sonos 1 speakers to complete the home theater experience. While the Sub added a bit of bass to music and movies, it wasn't really noticeable enough to warrant the $600 price tag. I'm sure the audiophiles out there will say it's necessary for the true sound experience, but I decided it was something I could live without and not miss.
customer_reviews.author: DJO949

customer_reviews.title: Sonos EZ.
customer_reviews.text: Enhanced the Sonos system (even I can tell the difference, and I’m certainly not an audiophile). I have Sonos 3, Soundbar, Sonos 5. No problem to set up. Greatly deepens sound. To be honest, if you are more adept at these things, I suspect there are much less expensive options. But I want easy and worry free from complex electronics. Sonos has exceptional support for klutzes and the thing is built like a brick outhouse.
customer_reviews.author: Jumpin’Jacks

customer_reviews.title: Makes a Difference I Wasn't Expecting
customer_reviews.text: I finally broke down and completed my Dolby 5.1 setup with the Sonos SUB. I was expecting to connect it and get much better bass... which I did. It's lovely, soul-punching sound you can feel. What I wasn't expecting was to get better sound from everything else! With the burden of bass lifted from the PLAYBAR and my rear ONE speakers, they are all much cleaner-sounding and the detail is fantastic. Had I known it would have made this much of a difference, I would have just bit the bullet and bought a SUB when I bought everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Dave2

customer_reviews.title: Looks great. Sounds great. Sets up in a minute.
customer_reviews.text: I added the sub to my playbar setup in just a couple minutes. I have it sitting adjacent to the couch and I love cranking the base when we’re watching movies and stuff. It’s really smart how it works as you can have a lot of base but the overall sound in the room is still crystal clear. It’s a great addition to the playbar. But why is it $500+?!?!?
customer_reviews.author: otiliorules

customer_reviews.title: Great sub
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sub! I purchased this with the Sonos sound bar, along with 2 play 1's, for an outstanding sound experience with my TV. Easy to set up, easy to control, only need one remote know for volume on my set. The sub delivers great sound, you can feel he bass, with no boominess. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: George Berggren

customer_reviews.title: If you can get past the price, the sound is great
customer_reviews.text: OK, no one made me buy this. Why I did is a bit of a long story, but suffice to say you will have to search long and hard to find a better sounding sub, and as with most Sonos products, the ease with which you incorporate this wireless speaker into your system is incomparably easy. Ah, if only it were a couple hundred bucks less.....
customer_reviews.author: wamaruna

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: If you were curious if you could give you overweight numb diabetic neighbors the chills from your own music blasting well look no further this sub knocks my whole first floor shakes. Incredible sound vibrations put you in the center of a nascar race
customer_reviews.author: Acucetta

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound - poor app Interface
customer_reviews.text: Sub is great. I have a Bose Acoustic 10 Sub as well but this scores points over it - for its sleek and contemporary design and the great sound. The interface and having to open Sonos app for everything is a big inconvenience. The apps such as apple music or spotify look different if accessed through this app. So it takes a little getting used to - if their was abilify to play directly from apps this would have been awesome.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Poor Amazon Warehouse Experience
customer_reviews.text: Faulty product. Won’t power on. Sonos support will process return but huge hassle to arrange return and so on. Obviously this was never tested.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Paired with my Sonos Beam. Expensive speaker but adds an incredible amount of depth to the sound. Plenty of base. I pair it with my Play:5 when “partying”.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Some serious bass
customer_reviews.text: I thought my Play:5 had some bass but this one punches it really hard. My glassware started to ring through the vibrations! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Varianti

customer_reviews.title: Great sub!
customer_reviews.text: Rivals my 2 velodyne subs. Adds nice bass to my TV. My music sounds better than ever. It’s beautiful as well ; looks like a modern piece of art. Pairs wonderfully with my Sonos playbar and play one speakers. Look for my playbar review for a more thorough details
customer_reviews.author: Yosefaaron

customer_reviews.title: This sub is heavy and feels very expensive. I ...
customer_reviews.text: This sub is heavy and feels very expensive. I placed my sub behind my sofa and can really feel the bass when watching movies. It's a noticeable change and significantly improved the overall quality of my system (playbar and play 5).
customer_reviews.author: Byron Ige

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, expensive
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a breeze with my play bar. Sound quality is excellent. However, this thing is expensive so really for anyone considering it - it's a luxury item. I managed to convince my wife that it was a technically awesome product but in her heart I know she believes it's just a toy for me. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and punch you in the chest good!
customer_reviews.text: I realize there are far better sounding systems for the price you pay for sonos but due to things like the eco system, being able to stream even sports now from a bathroom or another room if you walk into another room when a game is on, looks, sound and the app, its worth it. Sub has a very tight and punchy sound. Just what I like. A+
customer_reviews.author: James Sheedy

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to Sonos system. Emphasis on “addition”.
customer_reviews.text: This was the last piece that I needed to complete my Sonos surround sound system. A must have to add depth to any sonos system. More money than what I wanted to spend but once I set this up with my sonos beam and surround speakers the whole system blended together into a full clean sounding system.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Man

customer_reviews.title: Best home sub in the market.
customer_reviews.text: Finally a product that its home-music friendly. Most of the subs out there work great for movies, primarily on a 5.1 setup. I found this sub sound phenomenal to listen to music on a 2.1 set up. I have few playing with paired PLAY1 and I couldn't be more happy. PRO: sharp and nice looking piece of equipment, easy installation, sound a+ CONS: hard to find one. Its a very heavy speaker :P
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Garay

customer_reviews.title: Works well but not cheap
customer_reviews.text: It sounds great when to notice it, however I seldom do (it's most noticeable it scenes with explosions, etc ). Looking back I'm not sure if I would buy this expensive speaker again because of it's limited impact in my viewing experience. Maybe if Iistened to hard rock music I might appreciate ( and notice ) it more.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must buy to compete a Sonos home system!
customer_reviews.text: Finally bit the bullet, and added the sub to my sound bar and two connected Sonos ones. Totally worth the extra expense to finish off my home system. Best quality and sound I’ve ever had. The bass it produces can shake your house, or your neighbors if turned up loud enough. Also does seem to make overall sound quality even better since the other speakers don’t have to handle producing all the bass anymore. Sonos is definitely the best option out there right now for sound quality, ease of install, smart home connectivity, and extensive features and customizability. Recommend to anyone wanting the best for their audio system.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Panek

customer_reviews.title: Love this Subwoofer! what a great addition to the system
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best addition to the Sonos system I have. Makes a huge difference with the system. I have to admit it is a little larger than I thought it would be, but I totally understand the size once I linked it the sound-bar and the two other speakers I have for surround.
customer_reviews.author: Italospeed

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful delicious sound
customer_reviews.text: Sonos as always executes amazing sound. I have set up two of my houses with sonos systems. One centered around a television the second house configured just for music. Traveling between the houses the app interface just works flawlessly. It is truly clean well distributed sound. Words cannot define the experience
customer_reviews.author: Logistics Operations Manager

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it
customer_reviews.text: While this is pricey and I had to pay for it in payments, the sound of this with the other sonos speakers is well worth it. It is truly room filling, clean bass that I haven’t regretted since I plugged it in.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Cawelti

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was hoping, except for a setup problem I had
customer_reviews.text: I originally rated this as basically worthless because it wouldn't pair at the same time as the Beam, even when using the add-on Boost. They pushed out a firmware update, and it worked immediately. I think others would not run into the same issue, so I'm raising my rating. If setup had worked first try without me spending an entire evening trying different approaches, I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Got this to go with my beam. I absolutely love the bass this thing produces and set up was super easy
customer_reviews.author: Ranveeeer singghh

customer_reviews.title: Super expensive. Super worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I know what you’re thinking: this thing is insanely expensive. And you know what? You’re right. But for how expensive it is, I promise you, it really sounds that good. You need to listen to it to know, but man. When I listen to music, I FEEL the bass, even at low volumes that blow my ear drums. And when we turn it up to watch a movie, my living room vibrates. We have this sub paired with a Beam and I hear new tracks I’ve never heard before on songs I’ve listened to for years.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan V. Rarick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and easy to use premier sound.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve oft questioned the price/quality trade with Sonos but I’m a believer now. If I had one request it would be the ability to get to advance room settings and surround settings without going 5 menus deep. Sound quality and build quality are excellent. I sold off all my other stuff and am working my way around house with Sonos sound.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Good bass and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of the high price but you pay for quality. I was not impressed at first but after moving it around a bit and finding the right location all without having to mess with wires I am now a believer. This Subwoofer works well. Glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Much more immersive sound on movies
customer_reviews.text: I debated for too long on adding a sub. Definitely worth it and have not regretted it at all. Crisp sound puncuates movies and rumbles on bass heavy songs.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm B

customer_reviews.title: Sonos makes sound easy.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been waiting on the sub for a while. Finally on Black Friday I did the deed. Very happy. It adds that bottom sound you’ll never know how you lived without. Yes, a little pricey. But the wireless setup and easy of use makes up for it.
customer_reviews.author: TechFam

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great. Looks great.
customer_reviews.text: Finally saved up enough amex points to reasonably add this to my playbar. What a difference it makes. I don't think it's the absolute best out there but it's good enough for me as I am not an audiophile. Makes watching TV and movies a very good experience. It doesn't make the walls shake or anything but definitely fills the room.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Now it’s working
customer_reviews.text: Update: After 4 hours on the ohone with SONOS, the problem turned out to be a defective Beam speaker. Now that they sent me a new one, everything is up and running. I like the bass that comes out of this for surround sound.
customer_reviews.author: RVwino

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great but...
customer_reviews.text: The bass sounds great from this sub but it wouldn’t stay connected to the network with my 5other Sonos speakers while listening to music. It’s a shame I had to return it because it sounded great, but a speaker that cost this much should not have issues staying connected.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: It’s a sonos sub
customer_reviews.text: It works, and it’s super easy to install. I think some of the reviews overhyped the bass though. It’s not like you’re going to have your mind totally blown like you would with some high end gear.
customer_reviews.author: MP1512

customer_reviews.title: Easy, quality wireless surround sound
customer_reviews.text: I was incredibly hesitant to take the dive into the Sonos world because of the prices, but after setting up a Beam, Sub, Play:1 (x2), and a Boost, I am now a believer. Totally worth the investment!!! The controller app could go for some usability tweaks to make things easier, but functions as required.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to set up (didn’t and is back in box and the sound quality of the bar (only thing that works) isn’t even close to what Bose had 15 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: m. p.

customer_reviews.title: Deep base that can be felt
customer_reviews.text: Added to Sonos sound bar. Amazingly deep base that can be felt when ya turn it up. Put it anywhere within range and it connects up all by itself. All ya gotta do is plug it into the power outlet. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing..
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing....My room had 2 Play:1s for surround and a Playbar which sounded great, but the sub changes everything. Controlled, no boom but a great tight bass note. Amazing and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to our Sonos system
customer_reviews.text: We listen to music constantly in our home. Less TV, more music is better. More LOUD music is even better. This was a great addition to our Sonos system. Happy with the amount of bass and quality. Crazy easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: abbyeb

customer_reviews.title: Get One!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Sonos SUB -- Its really easy to set up and add to a Sonos system. HEY all you cry babies who don't have enough bass in the BEAM, get one of these if the room is big enough for bass.
customer_reviews.author: M&J

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sub
customer_reviews.text: We have many Sonos products and are thrilled with the function of them all. This sub is great too & the sound quality is amazing. However, despite being a Sonos fan, we do consider them to be overpriced. I considered this one to be worthy of a Father’s Day splurge.
customer_reviews.author: d&sdinkel

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive, but awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Waaaayyyyy too expensive, but if you already invested in the Sonos platform it is a must. I have x4 - 1’s, x1 - 3, and x1 -5. I thought it sounded good until I added the Sonos sub. Now it sounds G-R-E-A-T!!!! It is a serious sound machine. If you can afford the sub - do it - do it!
customer_reviews.author: Public Name Here

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: This sub is a great addition to our Sonos amp setup with in-ceiling speakers. In my last house I had a wired sub for the extra bass I like. I didn’t want to deal with running a wire in the new home so I tried this sub. It’s great, although a bit pricey but it works well and was easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: TXLoanStar

customer_reviews.title: Great Bass and piece for surround sound system.
customer_reviews.text: With Subwoofer, my surround sound system is complete. Easy to setup and up to the mark. Sonos system is one of the best purchases that makes me happy every time I think of. Great bass!!! For surround sound system, I got one playbar, two sonos play1 and subwoofer.
customer_reviews.author: Dharmesh Surti

product_meta.title: Sonos Sub - The Wireless Subwoofer for Deep Bass - Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:SUB OnlySonos Sub is the wireless subwoofer for deep bass. Enhance your listening experience when you connect Sub to any Sonos system. Add more dimension to home theater when you pair Sub with Beam, Playbar, or Playbase plus a pair of Sonos speakers for surround sound. Works wherever you place it. Stand Sub upright or lay it on its side. You can even tuck it under the couch. Experience pure bass with zero buzz, rattle, or vibration.
feature_bullets: The wireless subwoofer for deep bass.
Hear and feel the difference when you wirelessly connect Sub to your Sonos system.
Stand it upright, place it on its side, or tuck it under the couch.
Pair with Sonos Beam, Playbar, or Playbase for incredible home theater and add rear surrounds for immersive sound.
Experience pure bass with zero buzz, rattle, or vibration. Power supply - Auto-switching 100-240 V, 50-60 Hz AC universal input
